page.title: 14Elton Fire Party
page.content: When the Derbyshire Fire Service was set up in the 1940s basic fire fight- ing equipment was provided in the remoter villages to be used while awaiting the arrival of appliances from the nearest fire station. Later, fire parties were formed and minimal training was provided. The fire box in Elton contains a hand siren, standpipe, turnkey, six hose reels, nozzle and list of hydrants. In 1983 fire party members prevented a barn fire from spreading to nearby properties. The fire party is to be disbanded in 1985. Appliances can reach the village in about twelve minutes from Matlock and the authorities are concerned about the danger of toxic fumes to untrained volunteers. Elton has the last fire party in Derbyshire and possibly in England.
